channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Overhanging tree, obstructing window/view from sunlight, 10th June
item.description:
On the corner of Somme Road, the bend before the green leading to the dead end of Somme Road. Driving down the road from Ladymsith Road, it is on the right hand side. It just needs trimming back as it’s overhanging out of control.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 25;27, Somme Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet
item.category: Ash Tree located on Highway land

item.title: Potholes covering the whole width of the road entrance, 10th June
item.description:
Many potholes covering the whole width of the road entrance. These cannot be avoiding when entering the road. Been like this for months/a year
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Meadoway, Bishop's Cleeve
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Large potholes/drop in height entering car park, 10th June
item.description:
At the entrance to the car park, there is a significant drop in height where the road/junction to car park has sunk. It’s near impossible to drive a car out without scrapping it, unless you have a 4x4. The same is also true further up the entrance into the car park (past the yellow barrier) where rain water has caused a large chanel in the road to form.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Hartley Lane, Shurdington, Tewkesbury
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 4xcars dumped on concrete apron on right side of Cam road and tree branches cut from tree outside 139 Cromwell road dumped by the car's, 10th June
item.description:
On the right hand side of Cam road 1 x white jaguar 1x green jaguar 1x grey volkswagon 1x red van
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 138, Cromwell Road, Lynworth, Cheltenham

item.category: Tree causing damage/obstruction to pavement or road

item.title: Unpermitted roadworks problem, 10th June
item.description:
Customer reports that the Temporary TS at the location are out of sync with the permanent signals on the crossroads of Moorend Park Road and the Shurdington Road. Therefore, the traffic is unable to flow and is building up and getting stuck in the roadworks. The signals are currently unmanned, which was a measure introduced previously to prevent such an issue arising.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rotating cone on pole 2 is missing., 10th June
item.description:
Gloucester Road controlled crossing. Pole 2, between Market Street and Bloomsbury Street, is missing its rotating tactile cone under the control box.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 22, Gloucester Road, Wymans Brook, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Several dead branches on silver birch, 10th June
item.description:
Directly outside 36 Kings Road Cheltenham GL52 6BG. There are several dead branches on this tree, which have been reported previously (and indeed about three years ago). The tree is clearly not healthy, and we are concerned that the dead branches will eventually fall off onto cars or people.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 38, Kings Road, Ewens Farm, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: The cover marked PO outside 15 Tensing Road has sunk and the tarmac has crumbled..very unstable and dips if you step on the corner, 10th June
item.description:
Outside no 15 Tensing Road next to marker (unsure which service marker belongs to) cover very wobbly and moves if stepped on

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Tensing Road, Naunton, Cheltenham

item.title: Dead branch in tree and branch around cable, 10th June
item.description:
Tree outside 132 old Bath Road has a visible dead branch as well as having a second brand around a street phone cable. Generally tree needs sorting. It is also reaching well onto our property and we would love it taking back too. Lovely tree just needs some attention. Many thanks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 132, Old Bath Road, Cheltenham
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Road surface disintegrating, 10th June
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 16, Oakland Avenue, Lynworth, Cheltenham

item.title: A pothole in road problem, 10th June
item.description:
Customer requests details of the diversionary route for the works at the location as they have staff who are arriving via various modes of transport and have concerns about planning ahead to allow enough time.

item.title: Grass verges not cit, 10th June
item.description:
The grass verges along Stoke Road (stoke orchard side) have not been cut and is in places a meter high! This is making the area look in kept and run down.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Huxley Way, Bishop's Cleeve
